pull.title: Add utxo_to_csv.py tool
pull.body:
This adds a new conversion tool, heavily based on `utxo_to_sqlite.py`, to produce a CSV file for the UTXO set.

I created this because I wanted something that produced a greppable UTXO set, and am upstreaming it as it may benefit others.

Unlike the sqlite version, it also dumps addresses/descriptors for the outputs.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34324. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | Concept ACK | [nervana21](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34324#issuecomment-3848930377) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#31560](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31560) (rpc: allow writing UTXO set to a named pipe, introduce dump_to_sqlite.sh script by theStack) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Try to run the tests locally, according to the documentation. However, a CI failure may still
happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

@@ -0,0 +1,377 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2026-present The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Tool to convert a compact-serialized UTXO set to a CSV file.
+
+The input UTXO set can be generated by Bitcoin Core with the `dumptxoutset` RPC:
+$ bitcoin-cli dumptxoutset ~/utxos.dat latest
+
+The created file contains columns for the txid (in hex), vout, value (in sats),
+coinbase (0 or 1), height, scriptpubkey (in hex), output descriptor.
+"""
+import argparse
+import os
+import csv
+import sys
+import time
+import hashlib
+from enum import Enum
+
+# Constants
+
+UTXO_DUMP_MAGIC = b'utxo\xff'
+UTXO_DUMP_VERSION = 2
+NET_MAGIC_BYTES = {
+    b"\xf9\xbe\xb4\xd9": "Mainnet",
+    b"\x0a\x03\xcf\x40": "Signet",
+    b"\x0b\x11\x09\x07": "Testnet3",
+    b"\x1c\x16\x3f\x28": "Testnet4",
+    b"\xfa\xbf\xb5\xda": "Regtest",
+}
+
+P2PKH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 0,
+    "Testnet3": 111,
+    "Testnet4": 111,
+    "Signet": 111,
+    "Regtest": 111,
+}
+
+P2SH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 5,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet4": 196,
+    "Signet": 196,
+    "Regtest": 196,
+}
+
+HRP_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": "bc",
+    "Testnet3": "tb",
+    "Testnet4": "tb",
+    "Signet": "tb",
+    "Regtest": "bcrt",
+}
+
+# Base58 encoding logic
+
+B58CHARS = '123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz'
+
+def byte_to_base58(b, version):
+    "Compute the Base58Check encoding of an input byte array with given version."""
+    result = ''
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hashlib.sha256(hashlib.sha256(b).digest()).digest() # append checksum
comments.body:
According to
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/fae71d30f7227594e2f59499cf7f7f9420284e04/src/base58.cpp#L154 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/fae71d30f7227594e2f59499cf7f7f9420284e04/src/base58.cpp#L141-L142
we only need the first 4 bytes of the hash

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,377 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2026-present The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Tool to convert a compact-serialized UTXO set to a CSV file.
+
+The input UTXO set can be generated by Bitcoin Core with the `dumptxoutset` RPC:
+$ bitcoin-cli dumptxoutset ~/utxos.dat latest
+
+The created file contains columns for the txid (in hex), vout, value (in sats),
+coinbase (0 or 1), height, scriptpubkey (in hex), output descriptor.
+"""
+import argparse
+import os
+import csv
+import sys
+import time
+import hashlib
+from enum import Enum
+
+# Constants
+
+UTXO_DUMP_MAGIC = b'utxo\xff'
+UTXO_DUMP_VERSION = 2
+NET_MAGIC_BYTES = {
+    b"\xf9\xbe\xb4\xd9": "Mainnet",
+    b"\x0a\x03\xcf\x40": "Signet",
+    b"\x0b\x11\x09\x07": "Testnet3",
+    b"\x1c\x16\x3f\x28": "Testnet4",
+    b"\xfa\xbf\xb5\xda": "Regtest",
+}
+
+P2PKH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 0,
+    "Testnet3": 111,
+    "Testnet4": 111,
+    "Signet": 111,
+    "Regtest": 111,
+}
+
+P2SH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 5,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet4": 196,
+    "Signet": 196,
+    "Regtest": 196,
+}
+
+HRP_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": "bc",
+    "Testnet3": "tb",
+    "Testnet4": "tb",
+    "Signet": "tb",
+    "Regtest": "bcrt",
+}
+
+# Base58 encoding logic
+
+B58CHARS = '123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz'
+
+def byte_to_base58(b, version):
+    "Compute the Base58Check encoding of an input byte array with given version."""
+    result = ''
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hashlib.sha256(hashlib.sha256(b).digest()).digest() # append checksum
+    value = int.from_bytes(b, 'big')
+    while value > 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[value % 58] + result
+        value //= 58
+    while b[0] == 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[0] + result
+        b = b[1:]
+    return result
+
+# Bech32 encoding logic
+
+BECH32_CHARSET = "qpzry9x8gf2tvdw0s3jn54khce6mua7l"
+BECH32_CONST = 1
+BECH32M_CONST = 0x2bc830a3
+
+class Encoding(Enum):
+    """Enumeration type to list the various supported encodings."""
+    BECH32 = 1
+    BECH32M = 2
+
+def bech32_polymod(values):
+    """Internal function that computes the Bech32 checksum."""
+    generator = [0x3b6a57b2, 0x26508e6d, 0x1ea119fa, 0x3d4233dd, 0x2a1462b3]
+    chk = 1
+    for value in values:
+        top = chk >> 25
+        chk = (chk & 0x1ffffff) << 5 ^ value
+        for i in range(5):
+            chk ^= generator[i] if ((top >> i) & 1) else 0
+    return chk
+
+def bech32_hrp_expand(hrp):
+    """Expand the HRP into values for checksum computation."""
+    return [ord(x) >> 5 for x in hrp] + [0] + [ord(x) & 31 for x in hrp]
+
+def bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute the checksum values given HRP and data."""
+    values = bech32_hrp_expand(hrp) + data
+    const = BECH32M_CONST if encoding == Encoding.BECH32M else BECH32_CONST
+    polymod = bech32_polymod(values + [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]) ^ const
+    return [(polymod >> 5 * (5 - i)) & 31 for i in range(6)]
+
+def bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute a Bech32 or Bech32m string given HRP and data values."""
+    combined = data + bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data)
+    return hrp + '1' + ''.join([BECH32_CHARSET[d] for d in combined])
+
+def convertbits(data, frombits, tobits, pad=True):
+    """General power-of-2 base conversion."""
+    acc = 0
+    bits = 0
+    ret = []
+    maxv = (1 << tobits) - 1
+    max_acc = (1 << (frombits + tobits - 1)) - 1
+    for value in data:
+        if value < 0 or (value >> frombits):
+            return None
+        acc = ((acc << frombits) | value) & max_acc
+        bits += frombits
+        while bits >= tobits:
+            bits -= tobits
+            ret.append((acc >> bits) & maxv)
+    if pad:
+        if bits:
+            ret.append((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv)
+    elif bits >= frombits or ((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv):
+        return None
+    return ret
+
+def encode_segwit_address(hrp, witver, witprog):
+    """Encode a segwit address."""
+    encoding = Encoding.BECH32 if witver == 0 else Encoding.BECH32M
+    ret = bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, [witver] + convertbits(witprog, 8, 5))
+    return ret
+
+# Address/descriptor encoding
+
+def decode_bare_multisig(spk):
+    """Given a scriptpubkey, return ([keys],m) if bare multisig, None otherwise."""
+    if len(spk) == 0 or spk[-1] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos = 0
+    keys = []
+    # Decode m
+    if spk[0] == 0:
+        m = 0
+        pos += 1
+    elif spk[0] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 or spk[1] < 17 or spk[1] > 20:
+            return None
+        m = spk[1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[0] >= 0x51 and spk[0] <= 0x60:
+        m = spk[0] - 0x50
+        pos += 1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode public keys
+    while pos < len(spk) and (spk[pos] == 33 or spk[pos] == 65):
+        if pos + 1 + spk[pos] > len(spk):
+            return None
+        keys.append(spk[pos + 1:pos + 1 + spk[pos]])
+        pos += 1 + spk[pos]
+    # Decode n
+    if pos >= len(spk):
+        return None
+    if spk[pos] == 0:
+        n = 0
+        pos +=1
+    elif spk[pos] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 + pos or spk[pos + 1] < 17 or spk[pos + 1] > 20:
+            return None
+        n = spk[pos + 1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[pos] >= 0x51 and spk[pos] <= 0x60:
+        n = spk[pos] - 0x50
+        pos +=1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode OP_CHECKMULTISIG
+    if pos >= len(spk) or spk[pos] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos +=1
+    # Finish
+    if pos != len(spk):
+        return None
+    if n != len(keys):
+        return None
+    if m > n:
+        return None
+    return keys, m
+
+def scriptpubkey_to_descriptor(spk, network_string):
+    """Infer a descriptor for the specified scriptpubkey."""
+    if len(spk) == 25 and spk[0] == 0x76 and spk[1] == 0xa9 and spk[2] == 20 and spk[23] == 0x88 and spk[24] == 0xac:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[3:23], P2PKH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 23 and spk[0] == 0xa9 and spk[1] == 20 and spk[22] == 0x87:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[1:21], P2SH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
comments.body:
based on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/fa942332b40c97375af0722f32f7575bca3af819/src/script/solver.cpp#L149 we need to skip the second element as well:

```suggestion
        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[2:22], P2SH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,377 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2026-present The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Tool to convert a compact-serialized UTXO set to a CSV file.
+
+The input UTXO set can be generated by Bitcoin Core with the `dumptxoutset` RPC:
+$ bitcoin-cli dumptxoutset ~/utxos.dat latest
+
+The created file contains columns for the txid (in hex), vout, value (in sats),
+coinbase (0 or 1), height, scriptpubkey (in hex), output descriptor.
+"""
+import argparse
+import os
+import csv
+import sys
+import time
+import hashlib
+from enum import Enum
+
+# Constants
+
+UTXO_DUMP_MAGIC = b'utxo\xff'
+UTXO_DUMP_VERSION = 2
+NET_MAGIC_BYTES = {
+    b"\xf9\xbe\xb4\xd9": "Mainnet",
+    b"\x0a\x03\xcf\x40": "Signet",
+    b"\x0b\x11\x09\x07": "Testnet3",
+    b"\x1c\x16\x3f\x28": "Testnet4",
+    b"\xfa\xbf\xb5\xda": "Regtest",
+}
+
+P2PKH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 0,
+    "Testnet3": 111,
+    "Testnet4": 111,
+    "Signet": 111,
+    "Regtest": 111,
+}
+
+P2SH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 5,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet4": 196,
+    "Signet": 196,
+    "Regtest": 196,
+}
+
+HRP_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": "bc",
+    "Testnet3": "tb",
+    "Testnet4": "tb",
+    "Signet": "tb",
+    "Regtest": "bcrt",
+}
+
+# Base58 encoding logic
+
+B58CHARS = '123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz'
+
+def byte_to_base58(b, version):
+    "Compute the Base58Check encoding of an input byte array with given version."""
+    result = ''
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hashlib.sha256(hashlib.sha256(b).digest()).digest() # append checksum
+    value = int.from_bytes(b, 'big')
+    while value > 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[value % 58] + result
+        value //= 58
+    while b[0] == 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[0] + result
+        b = b[1:]
+    return result
+
+# Bech32 encoding logic
+
+BECH32_CHARSET = "qpzry9x8gf2tvdw0s3jn54khce6mua7l"
+BECH32_CONST = 1
+BECH32M_CONST = 0x2bc830a3
+
+class Encoding(Enum):
+    """Enumeration type to list the various supported encodings."""
+    BECH32 = 1
+    BECH32M = 2
+
+def bech32_polymod(values):
+    """Internal function that computes the Bech32 checksum."""
+    generator = [0x3b6a57b2, 0x26508e6d, 0x1ea119fa, 0x3d4233dd, 0x2a1462b3]
+    chk = 1
+    for value in values:
+        top = chk >> 25
+        chk = (chk & 0x1ffffff) << 5 ^ value
+        for i in range(5):
+            chk ^= generator[i] if ((top >> i) & 1) else 0
+    return chk
+
+def bech32_hrp_expand(hrp):
+    """Expand the HRP into values for checksum computation."""
+    return [ord(x) >> 5 for x in hrp] + [0] + [ord(x) & 31 for x in hrp]
+
+def bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute the checksum values given HRP and data."""
+    values = bech32_hrp_expand(hrp) + data
+    const = BECH32M_CONST if encoding == Encoding.BECH32M else BECH32_CONST
+    polymod = bech32_polymod(values + [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]) ^ const
+    return [(polymod >> 5 * (5 - i)) & 31 for i in range(6)]
+
+def bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute a Bech32 or Bech32m string given HRP and data values."""
+    combined = data + bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data)
+    return hrp + '1' + ''.join([BECH32_CHARSET[d] for d in combined])
+
+def convertbits(data, frombits, tobits, pad=True):
+    """General power-of-2 base conversion."""
+    acc = 0
+    bits = 0
+    ret = []
+    maxv = (1 << tobits) - 1
+    max_acc = (1 << (frombits + tobits - 1)) - 1
+    for value in data:
+        if value < 0 or (value >> frombits):
+            return None
+        acc = ((acc << frombits) | value) & max_acc
+        bits += frombits
+        while bits >= tobits:
+            bits -= tobits
+            ret.append((acc >> bits) & maxv)
+    if pad:
+        if bits:
+            ret.append((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv)
+    elif bits >= frombits or ((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv):
+        return None
+    return ret
+
+def encode_segwit_address(hrp, witver, witprog):
+    """Encode a segwit address."""
+    encoding = Encoding.BECH32 if witver == 0 else Encoding.BECH32M
+    ret = bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, [witver] + convertbits(witprog, 8, 5))
+    return ret
+
+# Address/descriptor encoding
+
+def decode_bare_multisig(spk):
+    """Given a scriptpubkey, return ([keys],m) if bare multisig, None otherwise."""
+    if len(spk) == 0 or spk[-1] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos = 0
+    keys = []
+    # Decode m
+    if spk[0] == 0:
+        m = 0
+        pos += 1
+    elif spk[0] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 or spk[1] < 17 or spk[1] > 20:
+            return None
+        m = spk[1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[0] >= 0x51 and spk[0] <= 0x60:
+        m = spk[0] - 0x50
+        pos += 1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode public keys
+    while pos < len(spk) and (spk[pos] == 33 or spk[pos] == 65):
+        if pos + 1 + spk[pos] > len(spk):
+            return None
+        keys.append(spk[pos + 1:pos + 1 + spk[pos]])
+        pos += 1 + spk[pos]
+    # Decode n
+    if pos >= len(spk):
+        return None
+    if spk[pos] == 0:
+        n = 0
+        pos +=1
+    elif spk[pos] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 + pos or spk[pos + 1] < 17 or spk[pos + 1] > 20:
+            return None
+        n = spk[pos + 1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[pos] >= 0x51 and spk[pos] <= 0x60:
+        n = spk[pos] - 0x50
+        pos +=1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode OP_CHECKMULTISIG
+    if pos >= len(spk) or spk[pos] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos +=1
+    # Finish
+    if pos != len(spk):
+        return None
+    if n != len(keys):
+        return None
+    if m > n:
+        return None
+    return keys, m
+
+def scriptpubkey_to_descriptor(spk, network_string):
+    """Infer a descriptor for the specified scriptpubkey."""
+    if len(spk) == 25 and spk[0] == 0x76 and spk[1] == 0xa9 and spk[2] == 20 and spk[23] == 0x88 and spk[24] == 0xac:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[3:23], P2PKH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 23 and spk[0] == 0xa9 and spk[1] == 20 and spk[22] == 0x87:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[1:21], P2SH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 22 and spk[0] == 0x00 and spk[1] == 20:
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], 0, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 34 and spk[0] == 0x00 and spk[1] == 32:
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], 0, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) >= 4 and len(spk) <= 42 and spk[0] >= 0x51 and spk[0] <= 0x60 and spk[1] + 2 == len(spk):
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], spk[0] - 0x50, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    multi = decode_bare_multisig(spk)
+    if multi is not None:
+        keys, m = multi
+        return f"multi({m}," + ",".join(key.hex() for key in keys) + ")"
+    return "raw(" + spk.hex() + ")"
+
+def read_varint(f):
comments.body: I understand if we don't want to dedup across test and helpers, but can we do that inside the same "UTXO" tools? https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32116#issuecomment-3761024683

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,377 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2026-present The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Tool to convert a compact-serialized UTXO set to a CSV file.
+
+The input UTXO set can be generated by Bitcoin Core with the `dumptxoutset` RPC:
+$ bitcoin-cli dumptxoutset ~/utxos.dat latest
+
+The created file contains columns for the txid (in hex), vout, value (in sats),
+coinbase (0 or 1), height, scriptpubkey (in hex), output descriptor.
+"""
+import argparse
+import os
+import csv
+import sys
+import time
+import hashlib
+from enum import Enum
+
+# Constants
+
+UTXO_DUMP_MAGIC = b'utxo\xff'
+UTXO_DUMP_VERSION = 2
+NET_MAGIC_BYTES = {
+    b"\xf9\xbe\xb4\xd9": "Mainnet",
+    b"\x0a\x03\xcf\x40": "Signet",
+    b"\x0b\x11\x09\x07": "Testnet3",
+    b"\x1c\x16\x3f\x28": "Testnet4",
+    b"\xfa\xbf\xb5\xda": "Regtest",
+}
+
+P2PKH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 0,
+    "Testnet3": 111,
+    "Testnet4": 111,
+    "Signet": 111,
+    "Regtest": 111,
+}
+
+P2SH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 5,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet4": 196,
+    "Signet": 196,
+    "Regtest": 196,
+}
+
+HRP_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": "bc",
+    "Testnet3": "tb",
+    "Testnet4": "tb",
+    "Signet": "tb",
+    "Regtest": "bcrt",
+}
+

+B58CHARS = '123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz'
+

@@ -0,0 +1,377 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2026-present The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Tool to convert a compact-serialized UTXO set to a CSV file.
+
+The input UTXO set can be generated by Bitcoin Core with the `dumptxoutset` RPC:
+$ bitcoin-cli dumptxoutset ~/utxos.dat latest
+
+The created file contains columns for the txid (in hex), vout, value (in sats),
+coinbase (0 or 1), height, scriptpubkey (in hex), output descriptor.
+"""
+import argparse
+import os
+import csv
+import sys
+import time
+import hashlib
+from enum import Enum
+
+# Constants
+
+UTXO_DUMP_MAGIC = b'utxo\xff'
+UTXO_DUMP_VERSION = 2
+NET_MAGIC_BYTES = {
+    b"\xf9\xbe\xb4\xd9": "Mainnet",
+    b"\x0a\x03\xcf\x40": "Signet",
+    b"\x0b\x11\x09\x07": "Testnet3",
+    b"\x1c\x16\x3f\x28": "Testnet4",
+    b"\xfa\xbf\xb5\xda": "Regtest",
+}
+
+P2PKH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 0,
+    "Testnet3": 111,
+    "Testnet4": 111,
+    "Signet": 111,
+    "Regtest": 111,
+}
+
+P2SH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 5,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet4": 196,
+    "Signet": 196,
+    "Regtest": 196,
+}
+
+HRP_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": "bc",
+    "Testnet3": "tb",
+    "Testnet4": "tb",
+    "Signet": "tb",
+    "Regtest": "bcrt",
+}
+
+# Base58 encoding logic
+
+B58CHARS = '123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz'
+
+def byte_to_base58(b, version):
+    "Compute the Base58Check encoding of an input byte array with given version."""
+    result = ''
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hashlib.sha256(hashlib.sha256(b).digest()).digest() # append checksum
+    value = int.from_bytes(b, 'big')
+    while value > 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[value % 58] + result
+        value //= 58
+    while b[0] == 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[0] + result
+        b = b[1:]
+    return result
+
+# Bech32 encoding logic
+
+BECH32_CHARSET = "qpzry9x8gf2tvdw0s3jn54khce6mua7l"
+BECH32_CONST = 1
+BECH32M_CONST = 0x2bc830a3
+
+class Encoding(Enum):
+    """Enumeration type to list the various supported encodings."""
+    BECH32 = 1
+    BECH32M = 2
+
+def bech32_polymod(values):
+    """Internal function that computes the Bech32 checksum."""
+    generator = [0x3b6a57b2, 0x26508e6d, 0x1ea119fa, 0x3d4233dd, 0x2a1462b3]
+    chk = 1
+    for value in values:
+        top = chk >> 25
+        chk = (chk & 0x1ffffff) << 5 ^ value
+        for i in range(5):
+            chk ^= generator[i] if ((top >> i) & 1) else 0
+    return chk
+
+def bech32_hrp_expand(hrp):
+    """Expand the HRP into values for checksum computation."""
+    return [ord(x) >> 5 for x in hrp] + [0] + [ord(x) & 31 for x in hrp]
+
+def bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute the checksum values given HRP and data."""
+    values = bech32_hrp_expand(hrp) + data
+    const = BECH32M_CONST if encoding == Encoding.BECH32M else BECH32_CONST
+    polymod = bech32_polymod(values + [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]) ^ const
+    return [(polymod >> 5 * (5 - i)) & 31 for i in range(6)]
+
+def bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute a Bech32 or Bech32m string given HRP and data values."""
+    combined = data + bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data)
+    return hrp + '1' + ''.join([BECH32_CHARSET[d] for d in combined])
+
+def convertbits(data, frombits, tobits, pad=True):
+    """General power-of-2 base conversion."""
+    acc = 0
+    bits = 0
+    ret = []
+    maxv = (1 << tobits) - 1
+    max_acc = (1 << (frombits + tobits - 1)) - 1
+    for value in data:
+        if value < 0 or (value >> frombits):
+            return None
+        acc = ((acc << frombits) | value) & max_acc
+        bits += frombits
+        while bits >= tobits:
+            bits -= tobits
+            ret.append((acc >> bits) & maxv)
+    if pad:
+        if bits:
+            ret.append((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv)
+    elif bits >= frombits or ((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv):
+        return None
+    return ret
+
+def encode_segwit_address(hrp, witver, witprog):
+    """Encode a segwit address."""
+    encoding = Encoding.BECH32 if witver == 0 else Encoding.BECH32M
+    ret = bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, [witver] + convertbits(witprog, 8, 5))
+    return ret
+
+# Address/descriptor encoding
+
+def decode_bare_multisig(spk):
+    """Given a scriptpubkey, return ([keys],m) if bare multisig, None otherwise."""
+    if len(spk) == 0 or spk[-1] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos = 0
+    keys = []
+    # Decode m
+    if spk[0] == 0:
+        m = 0
+        pos += 1
+    elif spk[0] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 or spk[1] < 17 or spk[1] > 20:
+            return None
+        m = spk[1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[0] >= 0x51 and spk[0] <= 0x60:
+        m = spk[0] - 0x50
+        pos += 1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode public keys
+    while pos < len(spk) and (spk[pos] == 33 or spk[pos] == 65):
+        if pos + 1 + spk[pos] > len(spk):
+            return None
+        keys.append(spk[pos + 1:pos + 1 + spk[pos]])
+        pos += 1 + spk[pos]
+    # Decode n
+    if pos >= len(spk):
+        return None
+    if spk[pos] == 0:
+        n = 0
+        pos +=1
+    elif spk[pos] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 + pos or spk[pos + 1] < 17 or spk[pos + 1] > 20:
+            return None
+        n = spk[pos + 1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[pos] >= 0x51 and spk[pos] <= 0x60:
+        n = spk[pos] - 0x50
+        pos +=1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode OP_CHECKMULTISIG
+    if pos >= len(spk) or spk[pos] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos +=1
+    # Finish
+    if pos != len(spk):
+        return None
+    if n != len(keys):
+        return None
+    if m > n:
+        return None
+    return keys, m
+
+def scriptpubkey_to_descriptor(spk, network_string):
+    """Infer a descriptor for the specified scriptpubkey."""
+    if len(spk) == 25 and spk[0] == 0x76 and spk[1] == 0xa9 and spk[2] == 20 and spk[23] == 0x88 and spk[24] == 0xac:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[3:23], P2PKH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 23 and spk[0] == 0xa9 and spk[1] == 20 and spk[22] == 0x87:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[1:21], P2SH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"

+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2026-present The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Tool to convert a compact-serialized UTXO set to a CSV file.
+
+The input UTXO set can be generated by Bitcoin Core with the `dumptxoutset` RPC:
+$ bitcoin-cli dumptxoutset ~/utxos.dat latest
+
+The created file contains columns for the txid (in hex), vout, value (in sats),
+coinbase (0 or 1), height, scriptpubkey (in hex), output descriptor.
+"""
+import argparse
+import os
+import csv
+import sys
+import time
+import hashlib
+from enum import Enum
+
+# Constants
+
+UTXO_DUMP_MAGIC = b'utxo\xff'
+UTXO_DUMP_VERSION = 2
+NET_MAGIC_BYTES = {
+    b"\xf9\xbe\xb4\xd9": "Mainnet",
+    b"\x0a\x03\xcf\x40": "Signet",
+    b"\x0b\x11\x09\x07": "Testnet3",
+    b"\x1c\x16\x3f\x28": "Testnet4",
+    b"\xfa\xbf\xb5\xda": "Regtest",
+}
+
+P2PKH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 0,
+    "Testnet3": 111,
+    "Testnet4": 111,
+    "Signet": 111,
+    "Regtest": 111,
+}
+
+P2SH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 5,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet4": 196,
+    "Signet": 196,
+    "Regtest": 196,
+}
+
+HRP_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": "bc",
+    "Testnet3": "tb",
+    "Testnet4": "tb",
+    "Signet": "tb",
+    "Regtest": "bcrt",
+}
+
+# Base58 encoding logic
+
+B58CHARS = '123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz'
+
+def byte_to_base58(b, version):
+    "Compute the Base58Check encoding of an input byte array with given version."""
+    result = ''
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hashlib.sha256(hashlib.sha256(b).digest()).digest() # append checksum
+    value = int.from_bytes(b, 'big')
+    while value > 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[value % 58] + result
+        value //= 58
+    while b[0] == 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[0] + result
+        b = b[1:]
+    return result
+
+# Bech32 encoding logic
+
+BECH32_CHARSET = "qpzry9x8gf2tvdw0s3jn54khce6mua7l"
+BECH32_CONST = 1
+BECH32M_CONST = 0x2bc830a3
+
+class Encoding(Enum):
+    """Enumeration type to list the various supported encodings."""
+    BECH32 = 1
+    BECH32M = 2
+
+def bech32_polymod(values):
+    """Internal function that computes the Bech32 checksum."""
+    generator = [0x3b6a57b2, 0x26508e6d, 0x1ea119fa, 0x3d4233dd, 0x2a1462b3]
+    chk = 1
+    for value in values:
+        top = chk >> 25
+        chk = (chk & 0x1ffffff) << 5 ^ value
+        for i in range(5):
+            chk ^= generator[i] if ((top >> i) & 1) else 0
+    return chk
+
+def bech32_hrp_expand(hrp):
+    """Expand the HRP into values for checksum computation."""
+    return [ord(x) >> 5 for x in hrp] + [0] + [ord(x) & 31 for x in hrp]
+
+def bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute the checksum values given HRP and data."""
+    values = bech32_hrp_expand(hrp) + data
+    const = BECH32M_CONST if encoding == Encoding.BECH32M else BECH32_CONST
+    polymod = bech32_polymod(values + [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]) ^ const
+    return [(polymod >> 5 * (5 - i)) & 31 for i in range(6)]
+
+def bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute a Bech32 or Bech32m string given HRP and data values."""
+    combined = data + bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data)
+    return hrp + '1' + ''.join([BECH32_CHARSET[d] for d in combined])
+
+def convertbits(data, frombits, tobits, pad=True):
+    """General power-of-2 base conversion."""
+    acc = 0
+    bits = 0
+    ret = []
+    maxv = (1 << tobits) - 1
+    max_acc = (1 << (frombits + tobits - 1)) - 1
+    for value in data:
+        if value < 0 or (value >> frombits):
+            return None
+        acc = ((acc << frombits) | value) & max_acc
+        bits += frombits
+        while bits >= tobits:
+            bits -= tobits
+            ret.append((acc >> bits) & maxv)
+    if pad:
+        if bits:
+            ret.append((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv)
+    elif bits >= frombits or ((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv):
+        return None
+    return ret
+
+def encode_segwit_address(hrp, witver, witprog):
+    """Encode a segwit address."""
+    encoding = Encoding.BECH32 if witver == 0 else Encoding.BECH32M
+    ret = bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, [witver] + convertbits(witprog, 8, 5))
+    return ret
+
+# Address/descriptor encoding
+
+def decode_bare_multisig(spk):
+    """Given a scriptpubkey, return ([keys],m) if bare multisig, None otherwise."""
+    if len(spk) == 0 or spk[-1] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos = 0
+    keys = []
+    # Decode m
+    if spk[0] == 0:
+        m = 0
+        pos += 1
+    elif spk[0] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 or spk[1] < 17 or spk[1] > 20:
+            return None
+        m = spk[1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[0] >= 0x51 and spk[0] <= 0x60:
+        m = spk[0] - 0x50
+        pos += 1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode public keys
+    while pos < len(spk) and (spk[pos] == 33 or spk[pos] == 65):
+        if pos + 1 + spk[pos] > len(spk):
+            return None
+        keys.append(spk[pos + 1:pos + 1 + spk[pos]])
+        pos += 1 + spk[pos]
+    # Decode n
+    if pos >= len(spk):
+        return None
+    if spk[pos] == 0:
+        n = 0
+        pos +=1
+    elif spk[pos] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 + pos or spk[pos + 1] < 17 or spk[pos + 1] > 20:
+            return None
+        n = spk[pos + 1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[pos] >= 0x51 and spk[pos] <= 0x60:
+        n = spk[pos] - 0x50
+        pos +=1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode OP_CHECKMULTISIG
+    if pos >= len(spk) or spk[pos] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos +=1
+    # Finish
+    if pos != len(spk):
+        return None
+    if n != len(keys):
+        return None
+    if m > n:
+        return None
+    return keys, m
+
+def scriptpubkey_to_descriptor(spk, network_string):
+    """Infer a descriptor for the specified scriptpubkey."""
+    if len(spk) == 25 and spk[0] == 0x76 and spk[1] == 0xa9 and spk[2] == 20 and spk[23] == 0x88 and spk[24] == 0xac:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[3:23], P2PKH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 23 and spk[0] == 0xa9 and spk[1] == 20 and spk[22] == 0x87:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[1:21], P2SH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 22 and spk[0] == 0x00 and spk[1] == 20:
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], 0, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 34 and spk[0] == 0x00 and spk[1] == 32:
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], 0, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) >= 4 and len(spk) <= 42 and spk[0] >= 0x51 and spk[0] <= 0x60 and spk[1] + 2 == len(spk):
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], spk[0] - 0x50, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    multi = decode_bare_multisig(spk)
+    if multi is not None:
+        keys, m = multi
+        return f"multi({m}," + ",".join(key.hex() for key in keys) + ")"
+    return "raw(" + spk.hex() + ")"
+
+def read_varint(f):

+            return None
+        keys.append(spk[pos + 1:pos + 1 + spk[pos]])
+        pos += 1 + spk[pos]
+    # Decode n
+    if pos >= len(spk):
+        return None
+    if spk[pos] == 0:
+        n = 0
+        pos +=1
+    elif spk[pos] == 1:
+        if len(spk) < 2 + pos or spk[pos + 1] < 17 or spk[pos + 1] > 20:
+            return None
+        n = spk[pos + 1]
+        pos += 2
+    elif spk[pos] >= 0x51 and spk[pos] <= 0x60:
+        n = spk[pos] - 0x50
+        pos +=1
+    else:
+        return None
+    # Decode OP_CHECKMULTISIG
+    if pos >= len(spk) or spk[pos] != 0xae:
+        return None
+    pos +=1
+    # Finish
+    if pos != len(spk):
+        return None
+    if n != len(keys):
+        return None
+    if m > n:
+        return None
+    return keys, m
+
+def scriptpubkey_to_descriptor(spk, network_string):
+    """Infer a descriptor for the specified scriptpubkey."""
+    if len(spk) == 25 and spk[0] == 0x76 and spk[1] == 0xa9 and spk[2] == 20 and spk[23] == 0x88 and spk[24] == 0xac:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[3:23], P2PKH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 23 and spk[0] == 0xa9 and spk[1] == 20 and spk[22] == 0x87:
+        return "addr(" + byte_to_base58(spk[1:21], P2SH_VERSIONS[network_string]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 22 and spk[0] == 0x00 and spk[1] == 20:
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], 0, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) == 34 and spk[0] == 0x00 and spk[1] == 32:
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], 0, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    if len(spk) >= 4 and len(spk) <= 42 and spk[0] >= 0x51 and spk[0] <= 0x60 and spk[1] + 2 == len(spk):
+        return "addr(" + encode_segwit_address(HRP_VERSIONS[network_string], spk[0] - 0x50, spk[2:]) + ")"
+    multi = decode_bare_multisig(spk)
+    if multi is not None:
+        keys, m = multi
+        return f"multi({m}," + ",".join(key.hex() for key in keys) + ")"
+    return "raw(" + spk.hex() + ")"
+
+def read_varint(f):

@@ -0,0 +1,376 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2026-present The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Tool to convert a compact-serialized UTXO set to a CSV file.
+
+The input UTXO set can be generated by Bitcoin Core with the `dumptxoutset` RPC:
+$ bitcoin-cli dumptxoutset ~/utxos.dat latest
+
+The created file contains columns for the txid (in hex), vout, value (in sats),
+coinbase (0 or 1), height, scriptpubkey (in hex), output descriptor.
+"""
+import argparse
+import os
+import csv
+import sys
+import time
+import hashlib
+from enum import Enum
+
+# Constants
+
+UTXO_DUMP_MAGIC = b'utxo\xff'
+UTXO_DUMP_VERSION = 2
+NET_MAGIC_BYTES = {
+    b"\xf9\xbe\xb4\xd9": "Mainnet",
+    b"\x0a\x03\xcf\x40": "Signet",
+    b"\x0b\x11\x09\x07": "Testnet3",
+    b"\x1c\x16\x3f\x28": "Testnet4",
+    b"\xfa\xbf\xb5\xda": "Regtest",
+}
+
+P2PKH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 0,
+    "Testnet3": 111,
+    "Testnet4": 111,
+    "Signet": 111,
+    "Regtest": 111,
+}
+
+P2SH_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": 5,
+    "Testnet3": 196,
+    "Testnet4": 196,
+    "Signet": 196,
+    "Regtest": 196,
+}
+
+HRP_VERSIONS = {
+    "Mainnet": "bc",
+    "Testnet3": "tb",
+    "Testnet4": "tb",
+    "Signet": "tb",
+    "Regtest": "bcrt",
+}
+
+# Base58 encoding logic
+
+B58CHARS = '123456789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijkmnopqrstuvwxyz'
+
+def byte_to_base58(b, version):
+    """Compute the Base58Check encoding of an input byte array with given version."""
+    result = ''
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hashlib.sha256(hashlib.sha256(b).digest()).digest()[:4] # append checksum
+    value = int.from_bytes(b, 'big')
+    while value > 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[value % 58] + result
+        value //= 58
+    while b[0] == 0:
+        result = B58CHARS[0] + result
+        b = b[1:]
+    return result
+
+# Bech32 encoding logic
+
+BECH32_CHARSET = "qpzry9x8gf2tvdw0s3jn54khce6mua7l"
+BECH32_CONST = 1
+BECH32M_CONST = 0x2bc830a3
+
+class Encoding(Enum):
+    """Enumeration type to list the various supported encodings."""
+    BECH32 = 1
+    BECH32M = 2
+
+def bech32_polymod(values):
+    """Internal function that computes the Bech32 checksum."""
+    generator = [0x3b6a57b2, 0x26508e6d, 0x1ea119fa, 0x3d4233dd, 0x2a1462b3]
+    chk = 1
+    for value in values:
+        top = chk >> 25
+        chk = (chk & 0x1ffffff) << 5 ^ value
+        for i in range(5):
+            chk ^= generator[i] if ((top >> i) & 1) else 0
+    return chk
+
+def bech32_hrp_expand(hrp):
+    """Expand the HRP into values for checksum computation."""
+    return [ord(x) >> 5 for x in hrp] + [0] + [ord(x) & 31 for x in hrp]
+
+def bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute the checksum values given HRP and data."""
+    values = bech32_hrp_expand(hrp) + data
+    const = BECH32M_CONST if encoding == Encoding.BECH32M else BECH32_CONST
+    polymod = bech32_polymod(values + [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]) ^ const
+    return [(polymod >> 5 * (5 - i)) & 31 for i in range(6)]
+
+def bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, data):
+    """Compute a Bech32 or Bech32m string given HRP and data values."""
+    combined = data + bech32_create_checksum(encoding, hrp, data)
+    return hrp + '1' + ''.join([BECH32_CHARSET[d] for d in combined])
+
+def convertbits(data, frombits, tobits, pad=True):
+    """General power-of-2 base conversion."""
+    acc = 0
+    bits = 0
+    ret = []
+    maxv = (1 << tobits) - 1
+    max_acc = (1 << (frombits + tobits - 1)) - 1
+    for value in data:
+        if value < 0 or (value >> frombits):
+            return None
+        acc = ((acc << frombits) | value) & max_acc
+        bits += frombits
+        while bits >= tobits:
+            bits -= tobits
+            ret.append((acc >> bits) & maxv)
+    if pad:
+        if bits:
+            ret.append((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv)
+    elif bits >= frombits or ((acc << (tobits - bits)) & maxv):
+        return None
+    return ret
+
+def encode_segwit_address(hrp, witver, witprog):
+    """Encode a segwit address."""
+    encoding = Encoding.BECH32 if witver == 0 else Encoding.BECH32M
+    ret = bech32_encode(encoding, hrp, [witver] + convertbits(witprog, frombits=8, tobits=5))
+    return ret
+
+# Address/descriptor encoding
+
+def decode_bare_multisig(spk):
comments.body: Ran the conversion locally, the multisig detection looks a bit loose, and I think some nonstandard scripts can get misclassified as multisig, see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5a0f49bd2661d82efe13740856764e4e17fc1d06/src/pubkey.h#L77-L79
